intro: Carex ornithopoda, commonly known as the birdfoot sedge, is a perennial plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like flower clusters. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, wind-pollinated flowers, typically green or brown in color. It is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
